group_1.textRight: | Welcome. |

group_1.textLeft: Going out of your way to visit, how unusual.

group_1.textRight: Ah, uh... sorry… Am I bothering you…?

group_1.textLeft: I’m merely somewhat surprised.
Well then, what is it that you wish to discuss @with me?

group_1.textRight: Um, I…
I’m thinking of making a picture book for @everyone to read...

group_1.textLeft: I take it you’re interested in becoming a @professional picture book author?

group_1.textRight: Yeah… If I publish any books, that’ll let all sorts of people read them.
That’s also my goal...
But what I wanted to ask Nemu-chan about today @was...
Would it be okay… for a character modelled after Ai-chan to appear in my picture book…?

group_1.textLeft: | Ai… The Uwasa of the Anonymous AI? |
...May I ask for the reason?

group_1.textRight: Sooner or later, Ai-chan will disappear...
Although I know this, I still feel lonely all the same @and very sad...
So I want to leave behind something of Ai-chan @in my picture books.

group_1.textLeft: ...I understand, you may.
You have my thanks, Sana.

group_1.textRight: U-Uh… But… I’m the one who should be thanking @you...

group_1.textLeft: I do wish that the stories I’ve created will be passed down forever,
but on the other hand, one could say it’s destiny for them to disappear with me, their creator...
I’d already given up hope on preserving the [textBlue:Rumors].

group_1.textRight: Ah…

group_1.textLeft: Therefore, I’m happy you wished to preserve Ai, @Sana.
Thank you.

group_1.textRight: No… Of course not…!
I’m the one who should do that, thank you for @allowing this…!

group_1.textLeft: | Did Sana decide to create picture books for the @sake of preserving [textBlue:Rumors]? |

group_1.textRight: Oh, that wasn’t why…

group_1.textLeft: | I see… |
Heh… Are you disappointed?

group_1.textRight: | A bit… |

group_1.textLeft: May I ask what your initial motivation to create @picture books was?

group_1.textRight: Ah, yeah…
I thought it would be good if I was able
to help people who are suffering like I was before, through the world of picture books...

group_1.textLeft: ...Seems you’re going to be an author who keeps readers at the front of her mind.
However, just creating something isn’t enough to attract people’s attention,
so do you want to eventually commercially publish
to expose many more people to your works?

group_1.textRight: Yeah…!

group_1.textLeft: When I was posting my novels online, a publishing company contacted me.
However, it would be foolish to just wait if you are actually aiming for that goal.
It’s best to approach publishers yourself to @get ahold of opportunities.

group_1.textRight: How would you approach them…?

group_1.textLeft: There are two main methods.

group_1.narration: “First is placing in the likes of an open call competition, @where your winning work can debut with a publishing company. @Second is becoming published through bringing your work @to the book publisher.”

group_1.textRight: Bringing… my work…!?

group_1.textLeft: Since the second route is quite difficult without concrete achievements,
I recommend the first method to get a sense @of what you’re capable of.
Supposing you don’t place but your work still @appears promising,
I expect you could attract an editor
to help you refine the contents, with an eye @towards eventual publication.

group_1.textRight: Do the people in charge… use email to @communicate…?

group_1.textLeft: I believe there would also be just as much talking @on the phone or meeting in-person.

group_1.textRight: (I’ll have to directly talk… to people who aren’t @magical girls…?)

group_1.textLeft: We would just need to consider how you would @meet with them...

group_1.textRight: ...That’s impossible for me...

group_1.textLeft: No, we don’t know that for sure.

group_1.textRight: (People who aren’t magical girls can’t perceive me…)
(Wanting to do something to put myself out there @never made any sense...)
...Nuh-uh, that’s enough.
Thanks, Nemu-chan...
I came here to ask you something and you even @gave me advice...

group_1.textLeft: No worries, but-

group_1.textRight: I’m heading back for now… @Alright then...
